The "Dynamics chart" dashboard
The "Dynamics chart"
dashboard
is designed for creating a chart that considers the change of data over time. All values for displaying data are borrowed from the
data source
.
Example of a custom dashboard:
The user can download the customized in PNG/JPEG/PDF/SVG format or print it.
By configured data decryption, it is possible to display additional data by clicking on the sector of the dynamics diagram.
Adding the Kanban board analytical panel to the
dashboard
profile is done in the visual editing mode. Drag-and-drop the "Dynamics diagram" dashboard from the "Elements" window to the
main workspace
.
The settings are accessed using the
button that opens the "Chart settings" modal window, containing five tabs.
Settings
Main settings
The first tab defines the main parameters of the analytical panel, such as:
Setting
Purpose
Data source
Specifying the data source needed to create the chart.+
"Table" dashboard
, added as part of a configured dashboard.
Name
Entering/displaying the name of the chart. The name will be displayed in the dashboard profile and apply for the entire dashboard.+
By default, the name "New Dynamics chart" is used.
Chart view
Defining the type of diagram. Possible values:
Column;
Linear.
The "Columnar" chart view is set by default.
Dynamics type
Selecting the type of calculation dynamics from the drop-down list. Possible periods:
Year;
Day;
Quarter;
Month;
Minute;
Week;
Half a year;
Second;
Hour.
By default, the chart type is set to "Day".
Column with a date
Selecting a "date" attribute type of the source. It is used to build a diagram (the abscissa axis).+
If there is a single column of the "Date"/"Date and Time" type, this column will be selected by default.
Number of data series
Selecting the number of data series to display. The selection is made by a switch. Possible values:
One
MOre than one.
The default value is "One"
.
Column for value aggregation
Selecting the data source field whose value will be used to aggregate the value.
If there is a single column of numeric type, this column will be selected by default.
Aggregation method
Selecting the aggregation method. Possible values:
Quantity;
Maximum;
Minimum;
Weighted average;
Average;
Amount.
The "Amount" value is used by default.
Column for naming a row
Selecting the data source field whose value will be used as the name of the grouped data.
This tab also contains the drop-down "Decryption of the diagram sector" block.
Which contains the following parameters:
Setting
Purpose
The column with the sector ID of the chart
The parameter is necessary for creating a decoding of the row value (Drill-down).
Display the decryption table
Opening an explanatory table with data when clicking on a sector of the chart.
The dashboard table for decryption
Selecting the dashboard table that will be displayed when clicking on a sector of the dynamics chart. The field is displayed when the "Display table with decryption" switch is active.
When decrypting, set the values of the Dashboard parameters
Defining values for dashboard parameters during decryption. Setting parameter values is available when the switch is active.
The button is available when the switch of the "When decrypting, set the values of the Dashboard parameters" parameter is active. Clicking on the button will be display a pair of "Dashboard parameters" and "Dashboard parameter values" fields.
Dashboard parameter
Selecting the dashboard parameter to set the value.
Values of dashboard parameters
Selecting the value of the dashboard parameter. Possible values:
Identifier of the chart sector;
Constant.
The default value is "Chart sector identifier".
Style customization
On the "Style of design" tab, the user can set the chart size and color scheme.
The following design parameters can be configured on this tab:
Setting
Purpose
Chart height, %
Setting the chart height and width. If needed, the "Maintain aspect ratio" option can be used by clicking the
button.
By default, the following parameters are set: chart height - 100%, chart width - 40%.
Chart width, %
Palette
Selecting a
palette
for the chart color style.
The selection is made from a dropdown list of standard or previously created palettes. The user can create a new palette or edit the selected one via the parameter action menu.
By default, the GreenData corporate color palette is set.
Palette color cyclicity
Enabling the cyclic repetition of palette colors for the chart.
Palette color cyclicity is enabled by default.
Accumulation chart
Selecting the column presentation style for visual data comparison.
Setting the group and column intervals using sliders or input values.
Grouping chart
Additional settings
The setting on the "Additional" tab allows adding JSON code containing additional options that will be displayed on the diagram after saving.
At the moment, JSON expressions are not used to customize dashboard elements.
Setting up filtering condition
The Filter tab provides setting for setting up additional data filtering.
To implement the setting, click
on the "Filter" tab, the system will display fields for entering filtering parameters.
Select the column whose data will be filtered, and then add a filtering condition using the drop-down list and specify the value of the selected condition in the next field. Possible values of the filtering conditions:
Equal to;
Not equal to;
Less than;
Greater than;
Less than or equal to;
Greater than or equal to.
Click
to add the next filtering condition.
Decryption
On this tab, the connection between two or more analytical panels is configured, i.e. the setting allows changing the data display of one analytical panel in real time depending on the selected value of another analytical panel.
For more information about configuring decryptions, see the  "
Drill Down Decryption
" article.
Use case
Letâ€™s assume the setup of the analytical panel "Dynamics diagram" using the example of the sale of dairy products with various parameters.
Use case 1
Using a dynamics diagram with a single row of data without setting up the decryption of the chart sector.
It is assumed that the System has the following objects which data is presented as a dynamics diagram:
These objects are instances of the "UPV. Sale of dairy products " object type.
The registry of the type "Dairy product" has the following form:
In this case, the values of the "Product" object attribute are derived from the "Dairy product" object types.
Since values are borrowed from a configured data source to display data on a dynamics diagram, it means that in addition to the object model, a data source should also be prepared.
In this case, the "Sale of dairy products"
object data source
is used, where objects are added for the source of the "Sale of dairy products" and "Dairy product" object types.
If necessary, rename the values in the right column of the "Fields added to the source" block. These values will be displayed when configuring the parameters of the dynamics diagram.
The relations between the object types are configured as follows:
The dynamics diagram can be configured after setting up the data source. To set up the diagram, perform the following:
1.
Create and open the dashboard
"Sale of dairy products".
2. In the visual editing mode, add the prepared data source using
.
3. In the visual setup mode, drag-and-drop the "Row" element from the "Groupings" tab and the "Kanban Board" dashboard from the "Analytical Panels" tab to the workspace.
.
4. Open the dynamics diagram settings using
5. In the opened settings window, select the "Sale of dairy products" data source and specify a similar name for the panel.
Replace the default value in the "Dynamics type" field with "Month" and in the "Column for value aggregation" field specify "The total cost of the product with US Dollar".
The remaining fields will be filled in by default.
6. Save the chart settings using "Ok" and the visual using the "Save"  on the "Elements" panel.
As a result, the dynamics diagram will look as follows:
When hovering the mouse cursor over a column of the chart, a value is displayed with the calculation of the total cost of the product for the selected month.
Use case 2
Using a dynamics diagram with a single row of data without setting up the decryption of the chart sector.
The settings in this case are identical to the settings in
Use case 1
, except for Step 5:
Here, in the modal settings window that opens, do the following:
select the "Sale of dairy products" data source;
specify the name for the "Sale of dairy products" panel;
replace the default value in the "Dynamics type" field with "Month";
replace the "Number of data series" set by default with the "More than one";
in the "Column for value aggregation" field, specify "Quantity";
in the "Column for the name of the series" field, if necessary, replace the value with "Product".
The remaining fields will be filled in by default.
After saving the settings, the dynamics diagram will look as follows:
When hovering the mouse cursor over a column of the diagram, a value is displayed with the calculation of the total cost of the product for the selected month.
Use case 3
Using a dynamics diagram with a single row of data without setting up the decryption of the diagram sector.
This case is considered based on a result of the configuration of
Use case 1
.
To set up decryption, prepare a data source for the component used as decryption.
This case uses, the "Sale of dairy products. Decryption" object data source, containing data of "UPV. Sale of dairy products" and "UPV. Dairy product" and "Private customer".
In this case, the connections are configured as follows:
On the "Filtering conditions" tab in the "Source parameters" block, create the "Purchase Date" parameter, as shown below:
Add a "By date of sale only" filtering algorithm for "Sale of dairy products" object type by creating a "Sale date" parameter in the algorithm profile:
The algorithm is written using
attr
,
param
and
truncdate
functions.
After substituting the "Sale date" filter parameter, the filtering conditions will look as follows:
Adding a prepared data source for decryption is done in the same way as the previously added data source:
The
"Table" dashboard
will be used for decryption by clicking on the sector of the diagram..
To add it, drag-and-drop the "Table" dashboard element from the "Analytical Panels" tab to the workspace.
After switching to the settings of the "Table" dashboard using
, in the opened modal window on the "Main" tab, add the "Sale of dairy products. Decryption" data source and specify the same name for the table.
Next, go to the "Decryption" tab, open the collapsed block "Use the current component as decryption" and add the decryption using the button of the same name. In the modal window, select the "Sale of dairy products" value as the Parent component and click
.
Then, the "Sale date" value is selected in the "Date parameter" field and the table settings are saved after clicking "OK".
Next, configure the table view (for more information, see the "
"Table" dashboard
") article) and save the visual using "OK" button on the Elements panel.
As a result, by clicking on a sector of the dynamics diagram, the data corresponding to this sector will be displayed in the table.
Use case 4
Using a dynamics diagram with a single row of data without setting up the decryption of the diagram sector.
The setup of the dynamics diagram for this example is presented in
Use case 2
.
To set up decryption, prepare a data source for the component used as decryption.
The preparation of the object data source for this case is done in the same way as the data source presented in Use case 3, except for the settings that are made on the "Filter condition" tab.
The difference is that two parameters are required for this case, so in the "Source Parameters" block, in addition to the "Purchase Date" parameter, the "Product" parameter is added:
For "Sale of dairy products" object type, add a filtering algorithm "By selected products and date of sale" in which profile "Product" and "Date of sale" parameters are created:
The algorithm code is written using the
attr
,
param
,
or
,
and
,
isNull
,
truncdate
and parentheses:
After substituting the "Sale date" filter parameter, the filtering conditions will look as follows:
This data source is not suitable for the case considered in Example No. 3, due to the fact that it requires two input parameters, and in Use case 3 only the "Sale date" parameter is passed.
The "Table" dashboard  will be used for decryption by clicking on the sector of the diagram.
To add it, drag-and-drop the "Table" dashboard element from the "Analytical Panels" tab to the workspace.
After switching to the settings of the "Table" dashboard using
, in the opened modal window on the "Main" tab, add the "Sale of dairy products. Decryption" prepared data source and specify the name of the table "Sale of dairy products Decryption".
Next, go to the "Decryption" tab, open the collapsed block "Use the current component as decryption" and add the decryption using the button of the same name. In the modal window, select the "Sale of dairy products" value as the Parent component and click
.
After that, the value "Date of purchase" is selected in the "Date parameter" field, and the value "Product" is specified as the row parameter, for which a connection with the "Product Code" is established using the "Column for row identifier" field. The table settings must be saved by clicking "Ok".
If necessary, the table view can be customized (for more information, see the
"Table" dashboard
article).
After saving the visual using "Ok" the "Elements" panel, the functionality of decrypting data in the table by clicking on the sector of the dynamics diagram will become available to the end user.
